content.description: This is a very short, 2 or 3 bolt problem here added to complete this section.  This could be considered a boulder problem.  Move up, clip, go lefty (10a) or right (11), clip, move up to the anchor.  It probably lies smack in the middle between 0 and 1 stars.
content.location: This is the leftmost problem on this short cliff.

content.description:
Recovery Room - located above 'The Visor' follow the hill up from the Surprising Crag to the 2nd highest bolted face with 4 routes. This is the route just right of the arete and left of '

Blackout

'. Get into the undercling (bolt), just off the deck and make a reach to a jug out and left, continue from here to the top. Just right of the 3rd bolt is possibly manufactured ? Not for sure. Grade is a little overrated, perhaps 11a/b.

The furthest right route on the Recovery Room wall,  it follows good holds through a straightforward  sequence to the anchors.  It is, however, blemished by a huge, chipped hold in the middle of an otherwise blank section near the top.

Directly above the Visor is a small wall sheltered from the wind with 4 routes on it.  This one shoots straight up the center of the steep and flat, west-facing wall to the left of the obvious, large crack/chimney/ramp thing.  Quite thin and bouldery, it will test your ability to crimp down hard on small but positive edges.  It is a little taste of Smith Rock out here on the Front Range....
content.protection: 4 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor, so bring 6 'draws and call it good.
